page.title: 13WILDLIFE DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: Within the D block there is a wide variety of habitats,characteristic flora and fauna abound.Sufficient traditional agriculture and forestry survives to enable viable populations of most species to survive.The habitat most threatened is the unusual marine influenced carr wetland.Much of this has been filled to provide a car park with the loss of maritime rush & the banded Agrion. Probably irreversible changes have been caused to this rare site.Noteworthy species include the Pine hawkmoth,Grizzled skipper,Twiggy mullein & Slender bird's foot trefoil. A major conservation experiment is in operation at Murrayton,where a colony of the endangered, South American Woolly Monkeys is established.Despite the 'diversity' there are no notified sites of special scientific interest in the block.It is far from Monkswood
